meanings.definition: The state or quality of being primal.
meanings.sent1: The primalities of the forest were evident in its untouched beauty.
meanings.sent2: The researcher studied the primalities of human behavior in different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The primalities of the situation made everyone laugh at the unexpected outcome.
meanings.sent4: Her art captured the primalities of emotion in a way that touched everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The primalities of nature's power were on full display during the storm.

meanings.definition: The most basic or fundamental aspects of something.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the primalities of math is crucial for solving complex problems.
meanings.sent2: The book delved into the primalities of good storytelling.
meanings.sent3: The chef focused on the primalities of flavor to create a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: His speech touched on the primalities of freedom and equality.
meanings.sent5: The primalities of music can be felt in every beat and melody.

meanings.definition: The original or earliest form of something.
meanings.sent1: Archaeologists discovered the primalities of ancient tools in the excavation site.
meanings.sent2: Studying the primalities of language evolution helps us understand our origins.
meanings.sent3: The children's game was a modern twist on the primalities of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting captured the primalities of the landscape in its purest form.
meanings.sent5: In the museum, you can see the primalities of early human civilization on display.
